{"id":1082783254,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"1 month, 2 weeks","timestamp":1698130337,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"14 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1082783254/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Add Two Numbers II","memory":"74 MB","code":"/**\n * Definition for singly-linked list.\n * struct ListNode {\n *     int val;\n *     ListNode *next;\n *     ListNode() : val(0), next(nullptr) {}\n *     ListNode(int x) : val(x), next(nullptr) {}\n *     ListNode(int x, ListNode *next) : val(x), next(next) {}\n * };\n */\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n    ListNode* addTwoNumbers(ListNode* l1, ListNode* l2) {\n        // Using Stacks for the Reversal\n        stack<int> stk1,stk2;\n        while(l1) {\n            stk1.push(l1->val);\n            l1=l1->next;\n        }\n        while(l2) {\n            stk2.push(l2->val);\n            l2=l2->next;\n        }\n        ListNode* sum=new ListNode();\n        while(!stk1.empty() || !stk2.empty()) {\n            if(!stk1.empty()) {\n                sum->val+=stk1.top();\n                stk1.pop();\n            }\n            if(!stk2.empty()) {\n                sum->val+=stk2.top();\n                stk2.pop();\n            }\n            ListNode* node=new ListNode(sum->val/10); // Handling Carry\n            sum->val%=10;\n            node->next=sum;\n            sum=node;\n        }\n        return sum->val==0?sum->next:sum;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"add-two-numbers-ii","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
